name: immured
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
kept as a prisoner or closed away and out of sight: immured in Immured in a dark airless cell, the hostages waited six months for their release.
staying or kept within certain limits, rather than freely developing or mixing with other people or things: Although not totally immured from the political activities of the 1930s, Williams appears to have been completely absorbed in his academic studies at Oxford.
